name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"1830b577-8b30-4032-82a6-f0175b7e59db","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: analyze","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"16bf0872-0a4d-4682-821a-a92b458a3a94","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function serves as the primary entry point for processing an individual Python source file. It acts as the coordinator between the raw file content and the AST visitor logic. Its responsibility is to ensure the module is correctly registered in the system's metadata and then trigger the recursive traversal of the code structure.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0b9a0548-30fe-4963-8374-91f14cd51940","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Static analysis is a multi-step process that starts with raw text. This function manages the transition from a string of code to a structured analysis model. It handles the initial "bookkeeping"—registering the file path and module name—before launching the visitor. By wrapping the core logic in error handling, it ensures that a single syntax error or unexpected edge case in one file does not crash the entire analysis suite, allowing the tool to be resilient when processing large, diverse codebases.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"05c7061a-5507-426b-9422-a6d0a009d9cd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"740f7117-0941-48a0-aa41-238a79593221","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Metadata Registration:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It checks if the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"import_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is already aware of this module. If not, it creates a record linking the module name (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils.network","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to its actual physical location on disk (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.filename","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"443aea8a-1929-4c75-ba6a-e1908fe497f3","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Parsing:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It uses the standard Python ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ast.parse","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" utility to convert the file's text content into an Abstract Syntax Tree.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7a44dcb3-b718-4602-91f8-3a92d606feaa","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Visitation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.visit()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on the resulting AST. This triggers the entire chain of "visit_" methods (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_FunctionDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", etc.) defined in the class.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2b8d6961-9e2d-482d-97dc-3346b73973cd","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Error Resilience:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The entire parsing and visitation process is wrapped in a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"try...except","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block. Any exceptions encountered during the analysis of a specific file are silently caught, ensuring the analyzer can proceed to the next file in the project.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7d8cb35b-e377-4a3b-a86d-0f8468d57afd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"If the analyzer is told to process ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"config.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"62da23bd-b410-4ba2-a9c5-96a3b7cc25e4","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"analyze","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" registers ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"config","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" -> ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"/path/to/config.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1ae7837c-69d0-407c-844c-f6a5ca94a3bc","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It parses the text in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"config.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"79b92c47-f362-4c97-b4b5-6752b8e2b431","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It starts the visitor.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f7d93940-dd56-4ccf-8ca8-a0d3b33cb4bb","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"config.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" contains valid code, it populates the scopes and definitions.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1be473c6-b521-4670-8a8a-5c1be55d53f3","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"config.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" contains a weird syntax error or a decorator the analyzer doesn't understand, the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"except","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block catches it, and the analyzer moves on to the next file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c5a69ff7-142d-4669-9f5f-33db5047e047","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
